bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, March 6, 1900

div1.p: Lazear reports that the Secretary of War, Elihu Root, will visit the camp. He discusses his laboratory work.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, March 6, 1900
div1.opener:
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4:30-6 P. M.
BALTIMORE.March 6, 1900
My dear Mother
div1.p:
The boxes reached us in good
condition and we are very glad to have
the contents. We were rather short on
sheets and the books were very welcome.
I was glad to get your letter yesterday.
You must have had some pretty cold
weather. When I went to the Express office
in Havana to ask for the boxes a young
man stepped forward and introduced himself
as Mr. Shater. He is the man who was with
Alex. This is employed here by the Southern
Express Co. He does not look bright
Secretary Root is to arrive in Havana
today. There is to be a reception tomorrow
for him at Gen. Woods palace in town
which we have to attend. The day after
tomorrow he comes out here to review
the troops of the division. Troops have
been coming in all day from the other
posts.

The baby has been doing better since we
were able to get milk for him. The condensed
milk was not a success. He is bac
a good deal by the fa which are
a great pest here.

DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.

I have been kept pretty busy here at the
laboratory. The work promises to be very
good, and I hope things will remain
as they are. There are constant rumors
of moves and changes but I suppose
that is common to all camps and I
am planning work as though we were
a fixture here.
